comments:
build I200503241400 motif linux

1. I selected a project and used Team->Synchronize with Repository.
2. In the Synchronize View [in the Synchronize perspective] a had a few conflicts.
3. I selected one of the conflict files and used 'Override and Update'

Durign the processa dialog showed up (some corfimation), I hit yes, after that
some other dialog came up, this second dialog had a combo box, the option list
of this combo box was opening and closing (very fast) non-stop. The dialog was
so flashy that I couldn't read anything else.

I could reproduce this problem a couple times but I can't do it anymore.

I got hundreds of this same message (11Mb) in my .log.

The exception you've included is coming from the markers view. It looks like 
there was something wrong in the table viewer. The dialog you saw may have 
been the Error Dialog. Moving to UI for comment.

Stefan, note that the motif Table was recently re-written, so it may be causing
the viewer grief.  Please have a quick look at this asap and let me know if
there's a problem in the Table.

Looks like it might be the table. We are catching UIJob failures at a furious
rate by the looks of things and are having a hard time logging them

Created an attachment (id=19238)
flashy dialog screenshot.

It just happened again. Here is a screenshot of the dialog that keeps blinking
when the problem happens.

This last time I'm not sure if the bug was caused by update from cvs task or by
the launching swt task that I also had running. The stacktrace is the same, it
took me less than one minute to take the screenshot and close eclipse and it
still logged 12Mb in my metadata/.log.

On a side note, the error dialog in the screenshot is not properly sized. 
There was another sizing error on GTK in bug 89203. Did something change on 
GTK that could be causing this?

Billy, I saw the words "GTK" and "not properly sized" in the same sentence, 
you might be interested.

Taking ownership since this is probably a Table problem, though I haven't been
able to reproduce it yet.
*** Bug 89410 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This causes Eclipse to become unusable, forcing the user to kill it.  Upgrading
to critical.

Upgrading to blocker.  This is interfering with my ability to complete my test
pass on Linux-Motif.
